metadata.title: Production Content Cleanup for Public and Auth Pages (Remove Dev/Instructional Copy)
metadata.prd_reference: Production-ready UX presentation and trust-oriented messaging for public-facing surfaces

context.background: The site still contains development-facing and instructional copy on visible pages (for example preview/testing notes, implementation references, and internal workflow commentary). This task makes public/auth surfaces production-appropriate by retaining product information and user guidance while removing dev-meta commentary.

design_constraints.constraint: Retain site/product information and legitimate user guidance, but remove internal implementation notes, preview/testing messaging, and dev-meta commentary.
Do not break existing auth/provisioning functionality while simplifying the visible copy.
Keep the copy concise, trustworthy, and aligned with a production clinic SaaS presentation.
Verify visually on desktop/mobile after content updates to ensure no awkward spacing or empty panels remain.

instruction.step: Audit visible copy on landing, login, and signup pages for development-facing or internal explanatory text (preview/testing, implementation notes, internal workflow commentary, task references).
Rewrite or remove those blocks so the pages present only product-facing information, clear user guidance, and production-appropriate trust messaging.
Preserve essential UX clarity (what the page is for, what users can do next, and key security/auth notes) without exposing implementation-oriented commentary.
Run `npm run typecheck` after copy/UI changes.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the updated content on `/`, `/login`, and `/signup` (desktop/mobile snapshots + console review).

validation_checklist.check: Landing page no longer shows internal/explanatory commentary such as dev-style “workflow” notes that read like implementation guidance.
Login/signup pages no longer show preview/testing/dev-environment instructional copy to end users.
Chrome DevTools MCP verification covers `/`, `/login`, and `/signup` with console review.

artifacts.artifact: Production-appropriate copy updates on public/auth pages

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Public-facing pages present product/user-facing content only and no longer expose development/instructional commentary.
Auth pages remain functional and understandable after copy cleanup.
Chrome DevTools MCP verification evidence is recorded before task completion.
Task XML is updated and renamed with `DONE_` prefix after completion.

output_spec.commit_message: refactor(healio-content): remove dev-facing copy from public auth pages

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, typecheck command, Chrome DevTools MCP snapshots/notes, and commit references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence for `/`, `/login`, and `/signup` (desktop/mobile + console review) before marking complete.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence records changed files/verification/commits as applicable.

references.verification_tool: Chrome DevTools MCP (required for frontend task verification)
